title.narrative: Strengthening Kenyan Secondary Education through introducing e-learning concept

description.narrative: Overall objective of the Project is to improve resources and quality of secondary education in Kenya through introducing e-learning concept. Poorly resourced schools will have access to high quality education through reasonable investment in ICT. Interacti ve learning process improves skills of students to apply what they have learnt in actual development problems in their communities. Interactive learning also supports democratic development because students learn of models from other countries and cultures .Project objective is 1) to build Kenyan network in which Finnish Peda.net learning platform developed and owned by University of Jyvaskyla is a part of teaching and learning 2) to develop a concept for own e-study material production and use in Kenya 3) t o produce e-materials for schools and publish it in Peda.net learning platform 4) disseminate the e-learning concept to number of other schools. e-learning concept taken from Finland will be developed in four Kenyan Partners schools which have cooperated f or years with Finnish Project partners. Implementation is under guidance of Finnish e-learning and Peda.net experts. Actual implementation will be through existing structures and Project role is to support Partner schools to apply modern learning methods. Immediate beneficiaries are 2600 students and 120 teachers in the Partner schools but aim is to disseminate the Project concept to another dozen schools for further validation of relevance of e-learning in Kenyan environment and have the concept better to respond to local environment. This will make number of direct beneficiaries to be over 7000. In long-term the whole sector of secondary education in Kenya could benefit of the concept. This is also hope of top management of Kenyan Ministry of Education.
